title: What serif is used here?
content:
Notice the "e" in the font. It comes up diagonally. I've yet to figure out what font this is.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20140720020439im_/http:/typophile.com/files/Screen-Shot-2013-02-07-at-1_4462.02.png)
author: pers0n

comments.content: I'm not sure it's printed. The repeating characters (/a, /s, /h etc.) seem different from each other.

It is reminiscent of a certain style to a couple of typefaces that were made in the beginning of the twentieth century by some Dutch craftsmen (like De Roos), but i couldn’t find a close match. I also doubt that you’ll find a digital version of this.
